hints_html: Notice that \(\displaystyle 10 \mid 5!\) and in fact this divides all values of \(\displaystyle m!\) for \(\displaystyle m \geq 5\). This reduces the computation to a small finite set.
hints_latex:
Notice that $\displaystyle 10 \mid 5!$ and in fact this divides all
values of $\displaystyle m!$ for $\displaystyle m \geq 5$. This reduces
the computation to a small finite set.
hints_raw: Notice that <math> \displaystyle 10 \mid 5! </math> and in fact this divides all values of <math> \displaystyle m! </math> for <math> \displaystyle m \geq 5</math>. This reduces the computation to a small finite set.
question: 1 (c)
sols_html:
From the hint, we immediately see that

\[\begin{aligned} 1! + 2! + 3! + 4! + 5! + ... + 100! &\equiv 1! + 2! + 3! + 4! \mod{10}\\ &\equiv 1 + 4 + 6 + 24 \mod{10}\\ &\equiv 5 \mod{10}\end{aligned}\]
statement_html:
Short answer questions: Each question carries 6 marks, your answers should quote the results being used and show your work.

Find the least positive residue of \(\displaystyle 1! + 2! + 3! + ... + 100!\) modulo 10

NOTE There was a typo in the original problem statement and the modulo 10 part was missing.

'''Short answer questions: Each question carries 6 marks, your answers should quote the results being used and show your work.'''
